newsitem.title: REPUBLIC OF IRELAND: Irish police arrest three suspected IRA members.
newsitem.headline: Irish police arrest three suspected IRA members.

text.p: Irish police said they had arrested three men in the southwestern town of Limerick on Monday on suspicion of being members of the IRA.
Membership of the Irish Republican Army (IRA) guerrilla group, which is fighting to end British rule of Northern Ireland, is illegal in the Irish Republic.
Police said the three suspects were being questioned on matters related to IRA activity. They declined to name them.

In June, an Irish policeman was shot dead during a botched robbery attempt in the town of Adare, near Limerick. The IRA admitted reponsibility but said the attack had not been authorised by its leadership.
